top_procedures.description: Provision of covid-19 test, nonprescription self-administered and self-collected use, fda approved, authorized or cleared, one test count
Chronic care management services, first 20 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Chronic care management services for two or more chronic conditions, additional 20 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Initial nursing facility care with moderate level of medical decision making, per day, if using time, at least 35 minutes

Intravenous injection, bebtelovimab, includes injection and post administration monitoring in the home or residence; this includes a beneficiary's home that has been made provider-based to the hospital during the covid-19 public health emergency
Chronic care management services for two or more chronic conditions, first 30 minutes provided personally by health care professional, per calendar month
Follow-up psychiatric collaborative care management, subsequent calendar month, first 60 minutes
Chronic care management services for two or more chronic conditions, additional 30 minutes provided personally by health care professional, per calendar month
Comprehensive assessment of and care planning for patients requiring chronic care management services (list separately in addition to primary monthly care management service)
Initial psychiatric collaborative care management, first calendar month, first 70 minutes

Intravenous infusion or subcutaneous injection, casirivimab and imdevimab includes infusion or injection, and post administration monitoring in the home or residence; this includes a beneficiary's home that has been made provider-based to the hospital duri
Care management services for behavioral health conditions, 20 minutes or more clinical staff time directed by health care professional
Psychiatric collaborative care management per calendar month, each additional 30 minutes
Subsequent nursing facility care with straightforward level of medical decision making, per day, if using time, at least 15 minutes
Annual wellness visit; includes a personalized prevention plan of service (pps), initial visit
Detection test by immunoassay with direct visual observation for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (covid-19)
Principal care management services for a single high-risk disease, first 30 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Subsequent nursing facility care with moderate level of medical decision making, per day, if using time, at least 30 minutes

Intravenous infusion, sotrovimab, includes infusion and post administration monitoring in the home or residence; this includes a beneficiary's home that has been made provider-based to the hospital during the covid-19 public health emergency
Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of established patient that may not require presence of healthcare professional
